Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	 "Thus begin the words of Avicenna.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	 "Oh, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last in the science of medicine, and its completion is fulfilled within it, and through its expositions and explanations, it is clear to me that I must complete it with this treatise, which is a division of the operation by hand, namely surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	 "Because the operation by hand has been abandoned in our region and in our time, to the point where its science is greatly diminished, and its traces have disappeared; and nothing remains of it except a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which were altered by most and led astray by those errors and obscurity until their intentions are closed and their power and art are prolonged.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	 "And it is clear to me that I should revive it with the arrangement of this treatise according to the way of exposition and explanation and abbreviation; and so that it may come with the forms of the cautery tools and other instruments of the work as it is by addition of the explanation, and for its preparation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	 "But the reason why a skilled artisan with his hand cannot be found in this our time is that the art of medicine is long and its practitioner must first be trained in the science of anatomy, which includes knowledge of the joints of the members and their shapes, as well as their union and separation; and he should have knowledge of the bones, nerves, and sinews, their number and arrangement; and of the pulsating and non-pulsating veins, and the places where they emerge.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	 And for that reason, Hippocrates said that a name is nothing but a word, and it is minor in speech, but most important in the art of healing.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	 But we have already mentioned this at the beginning of this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable in what we have said about anatomy will inevitably fall into error, which will lead to the death of men, as I have seen happen many times, because some are educated in this science but abandon it without knowledge or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	 For I have seen a foolish and inexperienced doctor cut into an scrofulous abscess on the neck of a woman, and he also cut some arteries of the neck, so that a great deal of blood flowed out until the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	 And I saw another doctor who attempted to remove a stone from a man who had suffered this condition, and the stone was large. When he tried to pull it out, he took with it a piece of the bladder, so that on the third day the man died.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	 And I myself was called to remove that stone, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I knew for sure that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	 And I saw another doctor who received payment of one duc from our land for surgery, and he treated a black castrated man whose thigh was fractured; the ignorant doctor prepared with pillows and cloths tied strongly over the wound, not allowing the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	 Then he released him according to his wishes, then bound him again, and left him bandaged for several days and ordered that the bandage be removed; and it happened in this way until the thigh and the foot were suppurated, and he reached destruction.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	 And I was called to him, and prepared to remove the bandage, and after achieving peace and calm, he admitted to his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	 But however, the corruption had already set in the limb, so it could not be restrained, and the corruption did not cease to spread throughout the limb until the patient was endangered.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	 And I saw another doctor who punctured a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated after a few days, until the evil within him was magnified.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	 This is because the black cautery is pure of melancholic humor, so it should not be applied with all iron, but only to the part that has suffered, and let the rest remain free from it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	 And for this reason, my sons, it is necessary that the operation with the hand be planned in two ways: one is an operation associated with health, and the other is work with which there is danger in the greatest disposition.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	 And I have already addressed this in every place of this book where an operation is performed with error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard against this and leave it, so that the pages do not find a way to speak and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	 Therefore, take up your weapons with diligence and under the protection of God, and your patients with happiness and resoluteness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	 And use the best way through the grace of God to obtain health and praiseworthy success, and leave behind terrible diseases that are difficult to heal, and keep your weapons away from what makes you fearful, so that confidence in your faith and in your name does not fail you; for it is more fitting to your glory, both now in this world and later to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	 Galen has already discussed this in some of his lectures:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	 "Do not treat evil patients, lest you be called evil doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	 And I have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	  Here begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	 The first chapter is ordered about the head and the forms of instruments and the iron points of the cauteries, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	 The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	 The second chapter is about incisions and perforations, and cups (ventouses), and wounds, and the extraction of arrows and similar things; all are arranged and ordered according to the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	 Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	 The third chapter is about restoration and dislocation, and the treatment of twists and similar things; this chapter is ordered concerning the head from top to bottom, and the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	 About cauterization with fire and sharp medicine and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	 With this begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	 I wish to speak about the qualities of the assistants for this cauterization and their drawbacks, and in which circumstances cautery should be avoided.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	 Therefore, I say that the discourse on the quality of the assistant for cauterization and their drawbacks is a long and complex discourse, subtle in its knowledge and hidden in secrecy; and many wise men have spoken about it, and they have disagreed among themselves, and for me it suffices to touch upon some of their discourses, lest this become too lengthy. ︎
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	 And so I say that you should apply cautery universally to any and all ailments, whether they have material substance or not, except for two ailments which are immaterial conditions.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	 For the dry and material condition, it is best to refrain from using cautery; because some say that cautery is beneficial for such a condition, while others argue against it, claiming that cautery is not suitable for an illness caused by heat and dryness, as the nature of fire is hot and dry. Therefore, it is appropriate to treat a hot and dry illness with cold and moist treatment.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	 And I disagree with those who say the opposite, that cautery is beneficial for all hot and dry illnesses found in human bodies. For when you compare the human body and its humidity to the condition of fire, you will find the human body cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	 And I say by the reasoning above that experience has already revealed this to me several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	 However, it is not necessary to go over what has already been thoroughly examined and practiced in the chapter on cautery by previous experience. One who knows the diversity of human conditions, the nature of illnesses within them, their causes, symptoms, and duration can understand this.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	 In the other conditions, do not be afraid, especially in cases of moist and cold diseases, for all doctors have agreed on this matter, and there is no disagreement about using cautery in these cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	 And know, children, that the secret of treatment by fire cautery and its goodness have been proven by using medicinal cautery, for fire is simple and its action only affects the member on which it is applied and does not harm the other members connected to it except slightly.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	 But the action of medicinal cautery reaches those members from which it is distant, and it quickly brings healing to the difficult-to-cure diseased member and quickly heals it.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	 But the fire, due to its superiority and the goodness of its substance, does only this: it causes superfluous [things] to leave. And we know this by experience and by the long service of studying the art about the truth of the causes; and for this reason I am excused from the length of the speech. And if it were not that it is not read in my book, here I would have hidden a secret with fire, and the quality of its operation in the bodies and its expulsion by which it expels diseases, demonstrated philosophically, which would be sharpened in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	 And know, children, that they disagree about the time in which it is suitable to perform cautery, and they consider springtime to be the best time for this.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	 And I say that cautery is suitable at all times, because the damage caused by accidental timing is overcome by the benefit of what can be achieved with cautery, and especially if the cautery is for painful or necessary pains, strong inflammations, and fistulas, which do not tolerate delay, lest something worse happens.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	 This does not matter in your opinion, or, children, only the common people and foolish doctors think this way, since with that illness which is healed by cautery there is always a recurrence, and they consider that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	 And the cause is not at all as they think because of this, since cautery is only used in places where medicine cannot reach and it dries up the humors which are the cause of the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	 But nevertheless, cautery surpasses medicine in terms of swiftness and effectiveness of its operation and the great skill of its practitioner.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	 And it is possible that the illness may return at some point in time, depending on the patient's constitution, the location of the illness, and the practitioner's skill, as well as what has been prepared in the patient's body regarding an accumulation of superfluidities, and what has been received by the patient through his diet and similar causes. However, if the illness for which cautery is administered is a subtle illness with few superfluities and humors, such as cautery for toothache and similar cases, it is possible that the pain may not return in that area. But this is done only in small areas.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	 And it is commonly said that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and this statement is true, for I do not consider anything else to be effective with medicine or any other cause before cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	 And the reason is contrary to that; and the intention that cautery is the last resort of medicine is only when the methods of treatment in certain diseases are administered, and those medicines do not succeed, and then at the end of the cause one administers cautery, and it proves effective for that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	 Therefore, from this we understand that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention which I believe the common people and many foolish doctors hold.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	 And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the similarity of gold and the sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	 They said that the site of cautery does not produce a scar, although this is not absolutely true, because I have seen and found that it does so only in certain bodies without others, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron as they said; however, when you make cautery with fire and with gold, it is not declared to you, for it ignites according to the quantity that you want by the friction of the gold, and because it prepares to receive a blow; and if you place the fire on it, the gold melts from the heat, and some leaves fall into the fire due to the artifice of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	 And for this, cautery with an iron must be done very gently and precisely in order to perform the operation correctly.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	 And I have already arranged this chapter on cautery according to the chapters, and I have arranged those from the head to the feet, so that I may clearly show the questioner what he wants.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	 Of the cautery for headache caused by cold and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	 The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	 This cauterization is used for cold and dampness, which are the causes of many diseases, such as headaches, excessive sweating, known as profuse sweating from the head to the temples and behind the ears, dizziness, toothache, sore throat, and generally all illnesses caused by cold, including paralysis, swelling, stroke, and similar conditions in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	 The method of this cauterization is as follows: first, instruct the patient to use a purgative medicine to cleanse the head for three or four nights, according to the strength of the patient, their age, and their habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	 And then instruct them to shave their head with a razor, and then make that person sit between your hands on a low bench, and let them place their hands on their feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	 And now, place the palm of your hand near the bridge of his nose between his eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	 But once your hand has reached the middle of his forehead, mark that spot with a stylus, and then ignite the cautery olive, which looks like this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	 And then place it on the marked spot, in such a way that it descends, with your hand holding it tightly and turning it slowly.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	 And then slightly lift your hand and look at the spot, and if you see any part of the bone exposed, even as small as a grain of wheat, then lift your hand. If not, place your hand back with that iron, or another one, if it has become cold, until you see what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	 And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the spot and let it sit for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	 And then place a soaked cloth on him, and leave it there until the scar of the burn is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	 And then treat the spot with Tetrapharmakon ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	 And they also say that as long as the wound remains open, the better it is for the arm, because it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	 And some of them said that the cord should be cauterized to the bone, and the cautery should be held until a part of the bone's appearance changes.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	 And then it should be scraped away what is attached to the bone, and then it should be treated.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	 And others said that with the cautery it should reach to the depth, until it presses strongly on the bone, until the bone gives way, and this is the method of making a small incision.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	 And they believed that from that place the vapors of the head are expelled.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	 And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then it should be treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	 But in my experience, I have not seen these two types of cautery done at all, except in some men out of fear; and if that is the case, it is better with health as it is, because the head is weakened by the loss of continuity, just as we have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of a weak nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	 And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and with that, one avoids and works for health.
Capitol segon.	 Chapter Two
Del cauteri del cap.	 "About the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	 "When the whole head suffers from chronic and prolonged pain in the patient, and uses of garlands, combs, head-purges, plasters, bandages, hairnets, girdles, and similar remedies have been attempted, especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that is not suitable or does not benefit the patient, then consider whether the patient's head is of strong constitution by nature; and if it is not fragile and finds great coldness, then cauterize that part with another cautery, leaving that one aside for a while.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	 "Then cauterize that [part of the head] with a cautery until the sinew is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	 "After cutting the sinew and exposing the bone to the extent we have described, cauterize that [part] with a cautery at the back of the head in the place called 'vas' – and this is the location where cupping is done.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	 "And be careful in this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will find a very different pain from the pain of all other head cauteries.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	 "And I say this because the cautery that is used for the horns of the head and the occiput should be finer than the one used for the middle part of the head; and this is its form.
Capitol ters.	 Capítulo tercero. (Chapter three)
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	 About the cauterization of new migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	 When pain occurs at the top of the head or when the pain extends to the eyes, evacuate with cleansing medications and administer other treatments as I have mentioned in the discussions on illnesses; if that does not help, then cauterization is performed in two ways: either by cauterizing with a sharp burning medicine or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	 However, cauterizing with a burning medicine is done by taking a piece of wool, scraping it and tying off the ends from both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	 Then immediately cut the painful area on the temple with a sharp needle until it is deeply buried under the skin, so that it remains hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	 Then press on it with a bandage to stop the bleeding and leave it for three hours; then remove it and pull out the wool, and let the wound remain open for two or three days, and then place a cloth soaked in wine vinegar over it until the area heals.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	 Then continue treating it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	 And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the twelfth treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	 And for the cauterization with iron according to this method, use fire for the cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	 and it is called a nailhead, because its tip is shaped like the head of a nail, which has some curvature, and in the middle of it there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	 Then place it over the area of pain and hold your hand steady so that the iron is not shaken and rotate the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	 And if the quantity that is shaken by the speed of the cord is such that most of it is shaken, lift your hand to ensure that the iron below is not shaken so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	 Then soak a cloth in salt water and place it over the area, leaving it there for three days; then place a clean cloth with an edge, and then treat with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	 And if you want to, cauterize with the tip of the knife according to this method, and be careful not to cut an artery in this particular newness.
Capitol quart.	 Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	 On the cauterization of old migraine.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	 When you are treating migraines with the water we mentioned in the previous treatment, and as stated in the divisions of illnesses, if the treatment is not effective and sometimes due to the severity of the illness, the first cautery with medicine or fire does not suffice, then it is necessary for you to heat the surgical knife until it is white-hot. This signifies on the painful area with a line as long as your little finger; and pause your hand for one moment and press it until you reach the vein and penetrate into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	 However, it is necessary for you to be cautious about the continuation of the jawbone, which is greatly affected by chewing, and that the muscle connected to it is not damaged and the nerve connected to it does not cause pain, and that a spasm does not occur.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	 And if it concerns the caution and care of blood flow from the artery that is cut, for in its cutting there is danger, and especially to those who do not know what they are doing and are not skilled or experienced; leave the operation at this point.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	 And I come to remind you of the regulation of blood flow from the vein according to its method, in its place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	 And if from this illness the patient does not benefit from this cautery and you see that the patient's body is able to tolerate it, then cauterize them in the middle of the head as we have described, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	 And if you see, administer the cautery that we mentioned in the chapter on archery with cautery having two blades, and this is a better and more beneficial cauterization.
Capitol .v.	 Chapter 5
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	 On the Cauterization of Earache.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	 When there is pain in the ear due to cold and it is treated with laxatives and other treatments that I have mentioned earlier, but the pain does not go away, then apply heat to the cautery. This type of cautery is called "punctum," and its form is as follows:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	 And then pierce near the heat source, and guide it around the entire ear like a wheel that is turning, or around each part of the ear if the pain is in a specific part.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	 Approach with the cautery from behind the ear, little by little, until you feel the spot with your finger.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	 And if the cautery of those points is done on the entire ear and it heals, then also treat the spots until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	 Chapter 6
De cauterizacio de turtura.	 On the Cautery of Torture
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	 Torture that is healed and cauterized is not only due to the species that come from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	 Avoid cauterization of the species that cause dryness or nerve spasm.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	 When you treat that species of torture with jars and purgatives and gargles, and your treatment does not succeed, then it is necessary for you to cauterize the patient with three cauteries: one at the root of the ear, the second a little below its temple, and the third at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	 And place your cautery in opposition to the afflicted area, for softening occurs only in the region that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	 And the way to perform the cautery is to cauterize it with a cautery at the right end of the ear, slightly above the horn of the head, and another on the temple, whose length should be according to the length of the little finger, and hold your hand with the cautery until the amount of half the thread is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	 And this is the form of the cautery, which is a species of the knife, the shape of which is before you (or the table).
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	 But however, it is more delicate than that one a little bit like bladders; and it is necessary that the blade in it lacks some of its excess thickness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	 Then care for the area with water that has been processed ahead of time until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	 Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	 On the Cauterization of Old Apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	 When apoplexy is old and you treat it with the water we have mentioned and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize them with four cauteries: on all the corners of their head; and with a cautery in the middle of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery in the nape.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	 And the manner of the cautery is made according to what has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	 And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is even more urgent; and then it should be treated with processed water.
Capitol .viii.	 Chapter VIII
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	 On the Cauterization of Forgetfulness caused by a Flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	 It is necessary that large cups and purifying pills be given to the patient at the beginning.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	 And next, shave the entire head of the patient and place on his temples the plaster made from wax as described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	 And repeat this several times, for that is the manner of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	 And do so according to the order of that doctor which I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	 And so if by these means the patient is cured, good; and if not, then make three cauteries on the lower part of his head, which should descend from the highest part of the head to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	 And place the thickness of a finger between each cautery, and then cure the cautery with the aforementioned water.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	 But if the patient has an addition (of a limb or other body part), and is tolerating it well, then make a cautery in the middle of that addition; and if the addition is larger, then make the cautery on both sides of the horns (or corners) of the addition.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	 Then cure it until it is healed; and let the scabs be olive-colored, as described earlier.
Capitol .ix.	 Chapter IX
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	 Of the Cauterization of Paralysis and the Softening of the Entire Body
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	 Then proceed in the cleansing of the head with jars and the aforementioned water; and next, shave the head of the patient, and then cauterize it with cauteries in the middle of the head, and with cauteries on all the corners of the head, and with cauteries on the lower part of it, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	 And if it is necessary in the illness of softening of the body due to excess humors and the patient tolerates it and the illness is strong, then burn with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and continuously with a cautery until the fluid runs out from under them, and raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	 And care for him until he is healed, and this should be cauterized well.
Capitol .x.	 Chapter 10
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	 On the Cautery of Epilepsy
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	 Do not cauterize an epileptic unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	 Therefore, it is necessary to purge the brain at the beginning with years and with the other cure that we have said in the division when the illness is great and tolerates the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	 And if it is a child who does not tolerate medicines, then administer gargles and chewables that purge, doing this for several days with the improvement of food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	 And then shave the head of the patient, and then cauterize him with one cautery in the middle of the head according to the aforementioned manner, and with another cautery on his occiput, and over each corner of the head, cauterize.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	 And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then apply cautery with pointed tools as mentioned before, ensuring that there is a state of relaxation and softness in the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	 And then proceed with the olive-oil cautery as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	 However, if the patient is a child, then apply a subtle cautery in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	 Chapter XI
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	 On Cauterizing Melancholy
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	 When the causes of melancholy are corrupt humidity and thick phlegm, then apply cautery with the pointed tools we have mentioned, ensuring there is paralysis present.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	 And if the cause of melancholy is an excess that inclines towards melancholy, and the patient's body is moist, then give them water to drink that purifies their brain as described earlier in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	 Then shave the patient's head, and make a decently-sized tonure from the hair, and place it in the middle of their head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	 And let the patient be seated and held on all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	 Then apply a liniment; and it is most appropriate to use old sheep's wool for this purpose.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	 And warm that one over a controlled fire, with measured heat, which he will bear when it is applied to him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	 And place that one in the middle of his head within the circle, and let it enter until he is numbed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	 And do this with the patient once a week, along with his other treatment, until he is healed; or if you prefer, cauterize that area making small points according to his size, unless you have the hand with a cautery arranged in this way: this is the type of cautery that moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	 And then place that area covered in cloth or gauze.
Capitol .xii.	 Chapter XII
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	 On the cauterization of water descending into the eye.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	 When it has been determined that the onset of water in the eye is due to the signs mentioned in the division, then begin and give the patient something to drink that cleanses his head, and keep him away from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	 And have him take baths in warm water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	 And then instruct him to shave his head, and cauterize that area with a cautery in the middle of his head; and then cauterize with two cauteries on both temples if the origin of the water is in both eyes, or on one side if it is in one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	 In this context, "incideys" is likely a form of the verb "to incise," meaning to make an incision or cut. "Am" could be short for "ad" or "apud," which means "at" or "near." "Cauteri" refers to the cautery instrument used for burning or cutting. "Totas las venas e arcerias" translates to "all the veins and arteries." "Dejos la codena" means "below the collarbone," referring to the area of the body below the clavicle. "E sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas" suggests that the incisions should be made far away, specifically in the region of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	 And beware of blood flow when cauterized; and if you see blood flow from him, stop it with some medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	 And I will come with wisdom concerning the extraction of arrows and the removal of those, and caution against blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	 And sometimes it is cauterized in the neck between two bones with two well-made cauteries.
Capitol .xiii.	 Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	 On Cauterizing Old Tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	 When tears from the eyes are old and habitual, and through the veins and arteries that are evident on the surface of the head, it is confirmed to be superfluous coldness, then cauterize with the cautery mentioned at the beginning of water falling in the eyes, and with a cautery in the middle of the head, and two cauteries in the neck between the two temples, and two cauteries in the neck between the two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	 And if you need to add [more treatment], then cauterize the entire side of the eye towards the end of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	 Chapter XIV.
