Capitol .xxvii.	 "Chapter XXVII.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	 "On the treatment of shoulder dislocation.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	 "Know that the shoulder joint is difficult to dislocate and likewise difficult to return; it can be dislocated in any direction, but most commonly forward from the back, and its dislocation cannot be hidden from you because it will be evident from the appearance or touch depending on how it has been dislocated. And when you set the dislocated shoulder with the arm, this is clearly indicated to you, for the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm nor can that muscle touch it.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	 "And it is necessary that you push and reduce the dislocation as soon as the swelling comes, for if it comes to the swelling, the reduction of it will be difficult, and it will not heal easily; and especially when it is in the back parts, because it is the worst of all other types of dislocations, and very painful, and many warm treatments can lead to death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	 And the restoration of him, when it is possible to reduce it, is that his hand be extended with two hands, and his arms be spread out, and the physician's hands be on the elbows and below him, and he should press the joint with the fingers of both his hands at the same time, or with the edge of his palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	 But if the dislocation is at the shoulder joints in front, then return it so that you bend his hand with your hand, until it strikes the elbow with the edge of your palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	 And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer strong extension and very strong force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	 And two assistants should extend the arm, and hold it in that same position with two other assistants, so that it is not moved away from the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	 And then the arm should be turned in every direction, since it is wrapped in a long folded cloth around his hand, or bandage.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	 And when the physician touches the joint with his hand, anoint that [joint] with some oil so that this is one of the causes which aid in the lubrication of the joint and make it easier; and then press the joint with strong pressure until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	 And approximately for the reduction of it is necessary that a bandage be placed on which there is astringency and dryness with egg white, and it should be tightened with a strong cord, and the arm should be suspended from the neck, and it should be left for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	 And approximately it should be released; and if the joint is formed in its place, then release the bandage of him and leave that.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	 And if you see that the joint is not strengthened, then repeat the bandage and the binding, and leave it for some days until it is tightened; and then release it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	 But if there is a severe occurrence near the reduction of the joint, and his condition is restless, then administer moistening in baths and gentle friction, and coldness, until it is relieved; or place on the joint aloe, as it is for strong motion; and then bind it tightly, and leave it on the bone day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	 And then remove that, and put him in a bath; and when he emerges, then rub the joint with temperate friction, and then apply aloe again, as it is for motion, once, and the second time, and the third time,
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	 In the process of bathing, until it is cleansed.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	 And if you wish, place a moist and scraped cowhide over that wound; and do this several times, because it is moist and reduces to its proper state.
Capitol .xxviii.	 Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	 About the treatment of dislocation in the wrist joint, which is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	 Sometimes the wrist of the hand is dislocated, and its reduction is easy, which is different from other joints. However, it is important that the reduction be done quickly in the hour in which it is dislocated, before the place becomes swollen or a swelling forms there.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	 The reduction of the dislocation is done by placing the patient's hand joint on a table and having them extend their hand, while the physician places his hand or palm on the prominent part of the joint and pushes it until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	 However, it is important to consider whether the palm has already been moved towards the back of the hand. If this is the case, let the patient place the back of their hand on a table in front of them for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is at the base of the back of the hand, then the position of the patient's hand should be entirely on the table, so that the doctor's hand falls on that prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	 And therefore, if it returns immediately, it is good; and if not, then strengthen it with a plaster that encourages the abscess to release and leave it; and do not repeat this, because if you do, neither you nor the patient can tolerate the reduction of pus that passes during the day.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	 But however, the joint remains according to its twisted nature; and if the patient feels no pain, except that the hand is softened and cannot strengthen anything; then know that the nerves are pinched or cut, and there is nothing wrong with him except that he should be strengthened with a cautery near the opening of it, and you will confer great benefit on him in this way.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	 Therefore, when the illness has returned, then place on him the plaster which we have recommended, and let it be left and strengthened for five days; and then it should be removed and left, and the patient's hand should be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	 But if the patient's movement is impeded and some heaviness occurs in him, then relieve it with warm water and some rubbing until it is alleviated.
Capitol .xxix.	 Chapter .29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	 About the treatment of dislocation of the toes.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	 Sometimes these [conditions] are dislocated at every turn.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	 And when one of these [conditions] is dislocated to the back of the palm or the front of it, then hold the finger and press the dislocation with your thumbs until it returns [to its normal position].
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	 And then support the head of the finger and suspend it in such a way that the dislocated part is facing downwards, and leave it like this for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	 And then suspend it and extend it until it is straight in its own day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	 And when it is night, bind it according to that story, and do not stop unbinding it during the day and exercising with movements, and bind it again at night; and do this for several days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	 And do the same if it is dislocated to the front of the hand, and bind it to that part and perform the same first operation until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	 Similarly, do the same when it is dislocated in other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	 Chapter .30
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	 On the treatment of spinal dislocation.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	 When complete dislocation occurs to any of the vertebrae in the back or neck, and many vertebrae are moved from their places, then there is no cure for that, because death comes to the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	 And the sign of this is that the patient's bowel movement occurs without their control and they cannot hold it back; often many members of them or both legs, or both arms, or one of those are softened; or a vertebra has been displaced from its place, because many times it has been displaced and many times the removal of these is done in four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	 Therefore, that which was removed to the rear parts is named gelotizatio.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	 However, the treatment of this is that when you consider if the gelotizatio occurs in childhood, then there is no cure for it, nor is there any hope of healing it completely.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	 But for those that occur due to a fall or a blow or something similar, the Ancients have already spoken of the manners of treatment at length, from which the greatest profit comes; but I have already shortened it, because the little that is left out does not detract much from it, due to my closeness to my own understanding. With this explanation, I have presented and formulated it through various instruments, with which I will show and explain it.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	 I say that in the case of gelotizatio that occurs in the front part of the feet, there is no ingenuity or cure for it; and similarly in the case where it is made at two laces.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	 And of those [ailments], only the one that occurs in the back is cured with what I recommend.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	 And the patient should be placed face up on a soft bed near a wall, and under him there should be a wet instrument to prevent his feet from being lifted.

De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	 This phrase translates to "On the treatment of a dislocated shoulder.

De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	 About the treatment of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	 The ankle is sometimes dislocated by slight movement, and sometimes it is dislocated according to custom, and the dislocation of it is done either at the inner parts or at the outer parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	 And the sign of its dislocation is that you see the ankle swollen on the side to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	 But the treatment of its reduction is easy, and that is to stretch it gently with the hands and to envelop it until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu. E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	 And then take the foot with your right hand on the upper side, and with your left hand on the lower side of the foot in the heel area.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	 And then pull the foot towards you with your right hand, and then two times with the left hand, and then extend it with the left hand; and press the sole of the foot with the right hand against the thigh without effort.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	 And do this two more times as we have said.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	 Then press the sole of the foot against the thigh a third time, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	 So if the foot returns to its normal position in one or two times following this method, and you see the foot swollen, it is good; but if not, then repeat the operation on him because he will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute. E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	 And then the physician reduces the dislocation with his hands, while another attendant holds the healthy part at the sides, because the dislocation returns with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	 And when the dislocation returns and its health is declared to you by reduction, then place a plaster and secure it with strong bandages, and bind the foot to the leg with a bandage.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	 And you should be careful or guard against the nerves that are behind the ankle, so that the bandage over them is not too strong and presses on them firmly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	 And then leave it for two or three days; and if the bandage becomes softened, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	 And then unbind it on the third day or the fourth, and forbid the patient from walking for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	 But if the patient is forced to walk before that time, it is not certain that the dislocation will not be dissolved and corrupted in him, and then he may not receive cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	 And if an abscess forms, then you should administer to him the treatment that we have previously mentioned in another place of care and poultice, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	 Chapter 34
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	 Of the treatment of dislocation of the toes.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	 Tell him who is dislocated to be wrapped with a bandage without much tension, and that it is not difficult, but rather easy.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	 However, if the dislocation is in some toes of the foot, then tell the patient to place their foot on a soft pad or on a table, and stand as if walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	 And then you stand on the toes, and place your foot on what is softest of the joints, and then step on it with all your weight until it returns to its proper position, and you see that it has been wrapped and no protrusion appears.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	 And then place under the sole of his foot a board that takes all the foot, which has two handles, and then strengthen it with a decent and firm binding for three days; and then unbind it and make him rest from walking for several days, until it is healed and recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	 Chapter 35
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	 Of the types of dislocation that are caused by a blow, or by a fracture, or by both together.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	 When such a cause occurs and you undertake the treatment of that dislocation and its restoration, many times death occurs.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	 And for this, it is not fitting that someone presumptuous interfere in his care, but rather one who is wise in the art, with long experience, merciful and compassionate, cautious, not rash or presumptuous; and who uses at the beginning of medicines that simply sedate inflammations, and leaves the patient to divine judgment, unless it is someone whom you expect salvation from ruin, with relief from the illness, and in which some hope appears.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	 And then strive immediately to make a reduction of it at the beginning of the cause, before an inflammation occurs.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	 And then if the member returns as desired, administer a regimen that sedates inflammation and treats the wound with what is suitable for it from the drying ointments.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	 And if there is a dislocation with fracture and the bones are separated, then bore through their substance, and do in it as we have said concerning simple illnesses, preceding in the places of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	 And guard and avoid according to your power that which is against the path of fear, as my preceding sermon has instructed you; for this is better for you with regard to your Creator, and more permanent to your glory, and more healthful to your true body in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	 "Thus ends the words of Al-Bukhari perfectly, for which may God be praised.
Amen.	 "Amen
